bioghist.p: Harold J. Chance (1898-1975) was the Director of Friends Peace Service of the American Friends Service Committee from 1943 to 1962. The son of John and Mabel Wood Chance of Hardin County, Iowa, Harold married Wannitta Allee in Oskaloosa in 1924. Howard Haines Brinton (1884-1973), a 1904 graduate of Haverford College, was a professor of religion who taught at at Mills, Earlham, Guilford, Bryn Mawr, and Haverford Colleges. He worked for the American Friends Service Committee in Europe and Japan. He and his wife Anna were Directors of Pendle Hill from 1936 to 1950. He was the author of many books and pamphlets on Quakerism, and was the first editor of the Friends Bulletin.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the papers of Harold J. Chance. Materials include: minutes, mailings, correspondence, and other materials related to Chance's work with the Friends Peace Service; journals kept by Chance (1938-1949); and writings and speeches. Also included are course and lecture notes of Howard H. Brinton. Topics of these lecture notes include history and religion, mysticism in various religions, religion and social change, and the philosophy of pacifism.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
